title: What is Kirillov's concept of God and how does it differ from traditional religion?
first_phrase: In the final part of this text, the concept of God that Kirillov refers to is explained. This is the non-personalized, metaphysical idea of God, not the devotional one present in organized religion. Kirillov believes that this God is only the substantial counterpart of a state of emptiness and fear in human beings. He sees the whole history of humanity as the invention of God so that people can continue to live without killing themselves. Despite this, Kirillov acknowledges that this God is necessary to humanity.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the concept of "believing" has been a solution to humanity's existential needs since the dawn of time. While some dismiss the idea of encountering God, it is evident that the invention of a divine being has allowed for peaceful coexistence, and the annulment of this notion marks a significant shift in the history of mankind.
